info.title: Frontend API Specification
info.description: This is an API specification that allows GET Cloud FrontEnd 2.0 to request for data to GET Cloud BackEnd 2.0.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

200.description: Get the overview status of a given MUI

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

200.description: Get the daily minimum SOC of a given MUI on the requested month. The first element of "data" is always day 1 of the requested month.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id or fleetgroup id that the user wants to add its tab or configure its properties.

requestBody.description: Add tabs or modify tabs for fleets and fleetgroups.

200.description: Successfully adding tabs/change tab configuration to the database.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id or fleetgroup id that the user wants to add its tab or configure its properties.

200.description: Successfully deleting the charger from the database.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id or fleetgroup id that the user wants to add its tab or configure its properties.

200.description: Get the list of tabs and its monitoring properties of the given fleet Id
Get the days with alarms of a given charger MUI on the requested month. 0 = no alarm (green), 1 = less severe alarm(s) (orange), 2 = severe alarm(s) (red), 3 = the day is not finished (blue)
Get the list of all alarms on the requested month, and calculate the sum of each alarm.
Get the alarm logs of all devices on a given fleet on the requested month.

Get the daily charging completion of a given fleet on the requested month. 0 = all BMUs have been charged (green), 1 = some BMUs have NOT been charged (orange), 2 = many BMUs have NOT been charged, 4 = the day is not finished (blue)
Get the charging logs of all devices on a given fleet on the requested month.
Get the number of missed charging for each device on the requested month.

Get the daily deep discharges status of a given fleet on the requested month. 0 = all BMUs+BMSs never experience deep discharges (green), 1 = some BMUs+BMSs experience deep discharges (orange), 2 = many BMUs+BMSs experience deep discharges, 4 = the day is not finished (blue)
Get the list of all alarms on the requested month, and calculate the sum of each alarm.
Get the number of missed charging for each device on the requested month.
Get the charging logs of all devices on a given fleet on the requested month.

Get the weekly equalization completion of a given fleet on the requested month. 0 = all BMUs have been charged, (green), 1 = some BMUs have NOT been charged (orange), 2 = many BMUs have NOT been charged, 4 = the day is not finished (blue). First item is week1, second item is week2, and so on.
Get the number of missed equalization for each device on the requested month.
Get the equalizing logs of all devices on a given fleet on the requested month.

name.description: The name of the new fleetgroup

description.description: The description of the new fleetgroup

isParentFleetgroup.description: True if the new fleetgroup will directly be under a Fleetgroup. False if it will directly be under a Customer.

parentId.description: The fleetgroup ID (if isParentFleetgroup=True) or the customer ID (if isParentFleetgroup=False) of the new fleetgroup. The ID is retrieved from the customer tree (see /customer endpoint).

200.description: Successfully registering the new fleetgroup.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleetgroup id that the user wants to rename and change description.

name.description: The new name of the fleetgroup

description.description: The new description of the fleetgroup

200.description: Successfully editing the fleetgroup.

name.description: The name of the new fleet

description.description: The description of the new fleet

isParentFleetgroup.description: True if the new fleet will directly be under a Fleetgroup. False if it will directly be under a Customer.

parentId.description: The fleetgroup ID (if isParentFleetgroup=True) or the customer ID (if isParentFleetgroup=False) of the new fleet. The ID is retrieved from the customer Tree (see /customer endpoint).

lattitude.description: The new lattitude coordinate of the fleet.

longitude.description: The new longitude coordinate of the fleet.

timezone.description: TZ database name. The timezone will be validated with the coordinates by frontend. API will not validate it.

200.description: Successfully registering the new fleet.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id that the user wants to rename or change coordinates/timezone.

name.description: The new name of the fleet

description.description: The new name of the fleet

lattitude.description: The new lattitude coordinate of the fleet.

longitude.description: The new longitude coordinate of the fleet.

timezone.description: TZ database name. The timezone will be validated with the coordinates by frontend. API will not validate it.

200.description: Successfully editing the fleet.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id that the user wants to activate.

200.description: Successfully activating the fleet.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id that the user wants to deactivate.

200.description: Successfully deactivating the fleet.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id or fleetgroup id that the user wants to move parent.

isParentFleetgroup.description: True if the fleet/fleetgroup will directly be under a Fleetgroup. False if it will directly be under a Customer.

parentId.description: The fleetgroup ID (if isParentFleetgroup=True) or the customer ID (if isParentFleetgroup=False) of the new fleet/fleetgroup. The ID is retrieved from the customer Tree (see /customer endpoint).

200.description: Successfully assigning the fleet/fleetgroup under a customer/fleetgroup.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Fleet id or fleetgroup id to be deleted.

200.description: Successfully deleting the charger from the database.
Get the list of all fleetgroups, fleets, devices, subcustomers, and fleetgroups/fleets/devices belonging to the subcustomers of the requesting user.

name.description: The name of the new customer

parentId.description: Either ID of the logged-id customer or the ID of his/her existing subcustomer, which will be the parent of the new customer. The ID is retrieved from the customer Tree (see /customer endpoint).

200.description: Successfully create a new subcustomer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the edited customer

post.summary: Edit an existing subcustomer or the customer itself

name.description: The new name of the customer

description.description: The new description of the customer

200.description: Successfully rename a (sub)customer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the subcustomer, which will be the parent of the new customer

parentId.description: The new parent ID for the subcustomer. The ID is retrieved from the customer Tree (see /customer endpoint).

200.description: Successfully update the parent of a subcustomer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the subcustomer. Retrieved from the customer tree (See /customer)

200.description: Successfully deleting the subcustomer

state.description: The current device state, whether it is charging or discharging.

soc.description: State of Charge of the BMU (Battery). The unit "%" is included in the response.

soh.description: State of Health of the BMU (Battery). The unit "%" is included in the response.

activeAlarms.description: Active alarms on device, separated by commas

voltage.description: Battery voltage. The unit "V" is included in the response.

capacity.description: Configured battery capacity. The unit "Ah" is included in the response.

temperature.description: Battery temperature. The unit "°C" is included in the response.

warningText.description: Explanation of triangle sign on the tree on the left.
warningText.example: Heat sink temperature is above high limit. This alarm is trigged when the temperature reaches the derate end threshold and is kept active until the derate start threshold is reached.

timestamp.description: the latest update timestamp of this status

data.description: Lowest state of charge per day.

quantity.description: List of values. The size of the array must equal to the category array.

values.description: List of basic configuration values, including the unit.
List of advanced configuration values, including the unit.

names.description: List of other configuration properties to include in the report. The report should include basic, advanced, and other

values.description: List of other configuration properties to include in the report. Including the units.

names: Instant log sample period (s);Instant log sample period;Instantlog sample period;Sampleperiod (s)

latestHistoryLogUpdate.description: Time of the last history log update (fleet's timezone).

latestEventLogUpdate.description: Time of the last event log update (fleet's timezone).

latestInstantLogUpdate.description: Time of the last instant log update (fleet's timezone).

latestCycleLogUpdate.description: Time of the last cycle log update (fleet's timezone).

latestEventLogUpdate.description: Time of the last event log update (fleet's timezone).

latestProtectiveLogUpdate.description: Time of the last protective log update (fleet's timezone).

latestHistogramUpdate.description: Time of the histogram update (fleet's timezone).

names.description: Attribute name (=column name in history logs table)

values.description: Values of the attributes. Each array inside values = 1 row

names.description: Attribute name (=column name in history logs table)

values.description: Values of the attributes. Each array inside values = 1 row

other.description: The complete version of history logs consists of basic, advanced, and other.

names.description: Attribute name (=column name in history logs table)

values.description: Values of the attributes. Each array inside values = 1 row

names: Discharge max battery temp (°);Discharge temperature max
Discharge min battery temp (°);Discharge temperature min
Charge start SOC (%);Charge state of charge start
Charge end SOC (%);Charge state of charge end
Charge max battery temp (°);Charge temperature max

xvalues.description: Tick texts for X-axis of the histogram.

y1values.description: Tick texts for Y1-axis of the histogram (minimum temperature). The number of elements is always the number of X-axis ticktext plus one.

y2values.description: Tick texts for Y2-axis of the histogram (maximum temperature). The number of elements is always the number of X-axis ticktext plus one.

xvalues.description: Tick texts for X-axis of the histogram.

y1values.description: Tick texts for Y1-axis of the histogram (minimum voltage). The number of elements is always the number of X-axis ticktext plus one.

y2values.description: Tick texts for Y2-axis of the histogram (maximum voltage). The number of elements is always the number of X-axis ticktext plus one.

xvalues.description: Tick texts for X-axis of the histogram.

y1values.description: Tick texts for Y1-axis of the histogram (discharge current). The number of elements is always the number of X-axis ticktext plus one.

y2values.description: Tick texts for Y2-axis of the histogram (regen current). The number of elements is always the number of X-axis ticktext plus one.

state.description: The current device state, whether it is Charging, Equalizing, Paused, Main charging, Additional charging, Maintenance charging, or Charging completed.

batteryType.description: Type of battery chemistry connected to this charger

activeAlarms.description: Active alarms on device, separated by commas

voltage.description: Charger voltage. The unit "V" is included in the response.

capacity.description: Configured battery capacity. The unit "Ah" is included in the response.

temperature.description: Charger temperature. The unit "°C" is included in the response.

warningText.description: Explanation of triangle sign on the tree on the left.
warningText.example: Heat sink temperature is above high limit. This alarm is trigged when the temperature reaches the derate end threshold and is kept active until the derate start threshold is reached.

data.description: Number of charge starts per day.
Number of kWh consumed mains energy per day.

message.example: Unauthorized: You must log in to do this.

time.description: The time when log was written

index.description: Index of the instant log since start of operation

instantLogPeriod.description: The amount of seconds between instant logs, 0 = off

fleetId.description: Which fleet id or fleetgroup id that the user wants to add its tab or configure its properties.

equalizingCycles.description: In a month, at least how many times do you want equalizing to happen (otherwise raise an warning), where equalize time >= 30 minutes
In a month, at least how many times do you want equalizing to happen (otherwise raise an warning), where equalize time >= 30 minutes

data.description: Daily charging completion status per day
